Articles.Content: Will the underwater world?
Subs are fun to build so I hope so.
Maybe as a dlc update. It would be good, but it seems like a big leap. Maybe in ksp 3 LoooL.
I don't expect sub parts on release, but maybe as a later update.

In an interview when Nate Simpson was asked if there was gonna be alien life he said there would be some pretty interesting stuff that you would find in the interstellar progression, so it wouldnt suprise me if there was an underwater planet inhabited by giant leviathans.
Nate said this game is a rockets game, so there has to be a line of what is build in stock and what is build in Mods. So I think right now that's probably a no no.

3 hours ago, Kosmix1 said:

In an interview when Nate Simpson was asked if there was gonna be alien life he said there would be some pretty interesting stuff that you would find in the interstellar progression, so it wouldnt suprise me if there was an underwater planet inhabited by giant leviathans.

Probably like the Easter eggs we have now, the ufos and stuff like that. If any there is any life, it will more than likely only plant life.
I wouldn't  be surprised if a few submarine and boat oriented parts are there (ballast tanks, suitable  props etc) to enable oceanic exploration, but I doubt it will get a lot of attention.
Well Nate Simpson just confirmed that the shadow on pufs ocean isnt a bug but something else, then that may mean we will get some pretty interesting underwater worlds to explore.

1 hour ago, Kosmix1 said:

Well Nate Simpson just confirmed that the shadow on pufs ocean isnt a bug but something else, then that may mean we will get some pretty interesting underwater worlds to explore.

Interesting...
